summary: This mod makes zackdip\'s Psiijic Re-skin versions into non-replacing craftable clothing and armor.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b]Psiijic Master Outfits
Version 1.2[/b][/center]

=========================================

1. Description

	I really liked zackdip\'s [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1854]Psiijic Re-Skin several versions[/url] textures for
	the Psiijic robes. However they were replacers for the vanilla Psiijic robes, which I would like to keep intact as much as
	possible, they were only obtainable through the console and only one could be active at once.

	This mod fixes that by making all of zackdip\'s versions available through crafting(smithing) without replacing vanilla textures
	and even adds leather versions of each. The hoods don\'t use the circlet slot so feel free to use circlets with them.

	NOTE: The Black, Blue, Red and Yellow sets had the same boots textures so don\'t be alarmed when you don\'t find blue, red or
	yellow boots. Just take the Black (Leather) Psiijic boots and you\'ll be fine. Same goes for Black and White gloves. Also I
	am not good with textures at all so don\'t bother asking me to make retextures. If someone is willing to make some be my
	guest, although, if you use zackdip\'s files as basis you should ask him.

	Also if you like the textures please endorse zackdip\'s file since it\'s his work, I just compiled them into a non-replacer mod.

[b]There is a French translation [url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/skyrim/mods/armurerie/armures/armure_psijic.php]here[/url][/b]

=========================================

2, Installation

	2.1 Manual Installation

		a. Download the file
		b. Open it with 7z WinRAR or WinZip
		c. Extract the files(or drag and drop) in steam\\steamapps\\common\\Skyrim\\Data
		d. It shouldn\'t ask about replacing any files but if it does, replace them but be aware of which mod\'s files you are replacing.
		e. Activate the plugin with your favorite mod management programme or the Skyrim Launcher

	2.2 Nexus Mod Manager(Recommended)

		a. Download the file using the \"DOWNLOAD WITH MANAGER\" button in the files page or downloads sub-page
		b. When download is complete activate the mod in the Nexus Mod Manager
		c. It shouldn\'t ask about replacing any files but if it does, replace them by pressing \"Yes to all\" and you\'re done.

=========================================

3. Sorting

	These files should be placed in the same order you place other mods that add items and clothing or armour. 

=========================================

4. Known Issues

	-The elven ears slightly pop out of the sides of the hood. It\'s a mesh issue. The hood might need a bit broadening up to fit the ears but it\'s not something I can do and it might make it look even stranger. be my guest in fixing the issue.


=========================================

5. Permissions

	-You are not allowed to upload this file on any other sites under any circumstances
	-If you want to modify or use the textures you\'ll have to ask for permission from [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1958504]zackdip[/url]
	-If you want to modify or use anything other than the texture files themselves, you have to ask me first.

=========================================

6. Credits

	Bethesda - For the Creation Kit
	zackdip - For his avesome [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1854]re-skins of the Psiijic robes[/url]
       Nitmara - For the [url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/skyrim/mods/armurerie/armures/armure_psijic.php]French translation[/url]
        ravenmast0r - fixed the problem with the female textures in first person in my absence

=========================================

7. Changelog

        1.2 - Fixed female First Person textures
	1.1 - Fixed problem with gloves disappearing when some armours were used
	1.0 - Initial Release
author: Apethnatos

files.name: Psiijic Master Outfits 1-1
files.changelogHtml: fixed problem that caused armours that occupied the forearm slot to make half the gloves invisible
